attributes.action: British Embassy to help bring Frank Rice back home
attributes.additional_details:
Former soldier Frank Rice, 49, from Wakefield, requires a ventilator to breathe after being taken ill with pneumonia while on holiday in the Dominican Republic.

The treatment is costing a $4,000 a day, but Mr Rice’s relatives say his travel insurer has refused to pay the medical bills because he failed to disclose he was suffering from a lung condition when he bought his holiday cover.

Mr Rice’s daughter Ashleigh, 19, said he had been in hospital since October 8 and doctors had to resuscitate him after he was taken off the ventilator temporarily.

She said the total cost of his treatment had already reached $29,000 and it could cost up to £100,000 to fly him home. The family has planned fundraising events including a sponsored walk and collections at rugby matches.

We want help from the British Embassy who have so far let the family down.
